name: Kepler-236
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-236 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-236 is a star with 0.40999999999999975 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.51 times its radius. It is located 949.67 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-236 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-236 b

Kepler-236 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 8.30 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-236.

The mass of Kepler-236 b is 2.84 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-236 b is 1.57 that of Earth. At 2.84 Earth masses, Kepler-236 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-236 c

Kepler-236 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 23.97 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-236.

The mass of Kepler-236 c is 5.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-236 c is 2 that of Earth. At 5.05 Earth masses, Kepler-236 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-236, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
